bug.author: Code4SAFrankie
bug.summary: Running hello world streamlit app gives Only one usage of each socket address error
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Running my hello world streamlit app gives the error socket.error: [Errno 10048] Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create a file uber_pickups.py with this code: <denchmark-code> import streamlit as st import pandas as pd import numpy as np
st.title('Uber pickups in NYC') </denchmark-code>
Run streamlit run uber_pickups.py <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
App shows with Uber pickups in NYC title. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
This error is shown: <denchmark-code> Traceback (most recent call last): File "c:\python27\lib\runpy.py", line 174, in _run_module_as_main "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name) File "c:\python27\lib\runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code exec code in run_globals File "C:\Python27\Scripts\streamlit.exe\__main__.py", line 9, in <module> File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 764, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 717, in main rv = self.invoke(ctx) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 1137, in invoke return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx)) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 956, in invoke return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 555, in invoke return callback(*args, **kwargs) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\streamlit\cli.py", line 154, in main_run _main_run(file_or_url, args) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\streamlit\cli.py", line 179, in _main_run bootstrap.run(file, command_line, args) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\streamlit\bootstrap.py", line 182, in run server.start(_on_server_start) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\streamlit\server\Server.py", line 197, in start start_listening(app) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\streamlit\server\Server.py", line 113, in start_listening app.listen(port) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\tornado\web.py", line 2042, in listen server.listen(port, address) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\tornado\tcpserver.py", line 143, in listen sockets = bind_sockets(port, address=address) File "c:\python27\lib\site-packages\tornado\netutil.py", line 168, in bind_sockets sock.bind(sockaddr) File "c:\python27\lib\socket.py", line 228, in meth return getattr(self._sock,name)(*args) socket.error: [Errno 10048] Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Debug info <denchmark-code>Streamlit version: 0.47.2 Python version: 3.7.1 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? pip on WinPython OS version: Windows 10 version 1903 Browser version: Firefox 69.0 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>

comments.comment: Turns out the error was due to me running jupyter-lab at the same time.
